perturbation.original_text: Company will at its expense, prior to the Launch Date obtain, and thereafter throughout the Term and for a period of six (6) months thereafter maintain, such policy or policies of insurance as is commercially reasonable for the transactions and business contemplated by this Agreement. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, Company will ensure that such policies contain a waiver of subrogation against ACSI, name ACSI and its assignees as additional insureds.  Company will not modify or terminate any coverage without giving at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to ACSI. Upon request from ACSI, Company will furnish to ACSI certificates of insurance and such other documentation relating to such policies as ACSI may reasonably request.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will at its expense, prior to the Launch Date obtain, and thereafter throughout the Term and for a period of six (6) months thereafter maintain, a policy of insurance. Company will ensure that such policies contain a waiver of subrogation against ACSI, name ACSI and its assignees as additional insureds. Company may modify or terminate any coverage. Upon request from ACSI, Company will furnish to ACSI certificates of insurance.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'such policy or policies of insurance as is commercially reasonable for the transactions and business contemplated by this Agreement' weakens the required coverage. The deletion of 'Company will not modify or terminate any coverage without giving at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to ACSI' allows the company to change the insurance without informing ACSI. The removal of 'and such other documentation relating to such policies as ACSI may reasonably request' restricts ACSI's ability to verify compliance. These changes introduce a legal contradiction with standard business practice and insurance regulations that mandate reasonable coverage and transparency.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Principles of Contract Law, Insurance Regulations

perturbation.original_text: Company will comply, and will ensure that the Mirror Company Site, the Spoken-Word Audio Products and all other activities undertaken through or in connection with the Mirror Company Site and this Agreement (including, without limitation, the participation of ACSI and its Affiliates as contemplated by this Agreement) comply with all applicable Laws.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will comply, and will ensure that the Mirror Company Site and the Spoken-Word Audio Products comply with Laws.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting 'all other activities undertaken through or in connection with the Mirror Company Site and this Agreement (including, without limitation, the participation of ACSI and its Affiliates as contemplated by this Agreement),' the obligation to ensure compliance with all applicable laws is narrowed. This reduces the scope of legal responsibility, creating a potential loophole for activities that might fall outside the direct operation of the Mirror Company Site or the Spoken-Word Audio Products but are still connected to the agreement. This omission creates a **legal contradiction** with corporate governance and compliance standards that require comprehensive legal adherence.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party will protect the Confidential Information of the other Party from misappropriation and unauthorized use or disclosure, and at a minimum, will take precautions at least as great as those taken to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event with less than reasonable care. Without limiting the foregoing, the Receiving Party will: (a) use such Confidential Information solely for the purposes for which it has been disclosed; and (b) disclose such Confidential
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will protect the Confidential Information of the other Party from unauthorized use or disclosure, and at a minimum, will take precautions. Without limiting the foregoing, the Receiving Party will: (a) use such Confidential Information solely for the purposes for which it has been disclosed; and (b) disclose such Confidential
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'misappropriation' and 'at least as great as those taken to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event with less than reasonable care' lowers the standard of care required for protecting confidential information. This omission reduces the legal recourse available if confidential information is compromised, creating a legal contradiction with trade secret laws and data protection regulations, which mandate a higher standard of care.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Laws, Data Protection Regulations
